content.description: Figure 1. Simplified cladogram of several orders of fish
content.question: Cods and icefish are the only orders of fish that include species that produce antifreeze proteins in their blood. Based on the cladogram in Figure 1, which of the following scenarios describes the most likely evolutionary history of antifreeze protein synthesis in fish?

choices.label: Antifreeze proteins arose twice, once in the cod lineage and once in the icefish lineage.
Antifreeze proteins arose once in a common ancestor of cods and icefish.
Antifreeze proteins arose once in the most recent common ancestor of whalefish and icefish.
Antifreeze proteins were lost repeatedly in fish lineages.

content.answer: Antifreeze proteins arose twice, once in the cod lineage and once in the icefish lineage.
